page.title: 10The Countryside
page.content: Most of the area is{pastureland} belonging to local farmers. Much of the land is over 250 metres above sea level. Farms have decreased in number. The pastureland is used mainly for the grazing of sheep with a small number of dairy cattle. Lower pastures, below 300 metres is used to produce 2 crops of hay for winter feed. The area lies on the western edge of the Pennines. Quarrying can also be seen. Local millstone has traditionally been used in the building of local houses and factories. This has resulted in much of the landscape being spoilt but recentely great efforts have been made to tidy up the results of past industrialisation.
